snippet: Amanda Curtis, the new Democratic United States Senate candidate, will not be able to jump-start her campaign using money left in Senator John Walsh’s bank account from his defunct campaign.
abstract: Amanda Curtis, who is replacing John Walsh as Montana's Democratic candidate for United States Senate, is not able to jump-start her campaign using money left in Walsh's bank account from his defunct campaign; Federal Election Commissions rules allow Walsh, who had more than $713,000 in his campaign account, to give $2,000 to his replacement.
lead_paragraph: Amanda Curtis, the new Democratic United States Senate candidate, will not be able to jump-start her campaign using money left in Senator John Walsh’s bank account from his defunct campaign.

headline.main: Montana: Senator Who Left Race Cannot Pass on His War Chest
headline.print_headline: Montana: Senator Who Left Race Cannot Pass on His War Chest
